summary:
The National Register of Historic Places is a list of special places in the U.S. that are important because of their history or unique design. It was started in 1966 by a law called the National Historic Preservation Act. There are over one million places on the list, like old buildings, sites, and even whole neighborhoods.

The National Park Service looks after the register and helps protect these places. Being on the list can help owners get tax benefits when they fix up these historic places. The government decides which places to add based on four main rules.
title: National Register of Historic Places
